content:
Yes, some gluten-free bread can be high in sugar and additives to make them more palatable. Here are some gluten-free bread options that are healthier:

1. Ezekiel bread: Ezekiel bread is made with sprouted grains, such as wheat, barley, and lentils, and it is naturally gluten-free. It is also rich in protein, fiber, and other nutrients.

2. Rudi's Gluten-Free bread: Rudi's Gluten-Free bread is made with natural ingredients such as rice flour, potato starch, and flaxseed. It has no artificial flavors or colors, and it is free from high-fructose corn syrup and preservatives.

3. Canyon Bakehouse Gluten-Free bread: Canyon Bakehouse Gluten-Free bread is made using 100% whole grains, and it is free from GMOs, dairy, and soy. It is also free from preservatives and artificial additives.

4. Udi's Gluten-Free bread: Udi's Gluten-Free bread is made with a blend of rice flour, tapioca starch, and potato starch. It is free from artificial flavors and colors, and it is also soy-free and dairy-free.

5. Simple Truth Gluten-Free bread: Simple Truth Gluten-Free bread is made using a blend of brown rice flour, sorghum flour, and quinoa flour. It is free from artificial preservatives and flavors, and it is also non-GMO.

Overall, it's always best to check labels and ingredient lists to ensure that you choose gluten-free bread that fits your dietary needs and preferences. Look for bread that is made with natural ingredients and has no added sugars or artificial additives.
